dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes arrives from Geneva. She is ushered through an INFRARED FACE SCAN machine that checks her temperature. T line is outrageously long. Children are checked with ear thermometers. She steps through the machine. Neo alarms, no problems. S is fifty feet away when a kerfuffle breaks out behind her man is being DETAINED. He is a bit older and speaks Engli with an accent. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: DETAINED
dialogues.text: My temperature is always high. I have a thyroid condition. But he is being led away by uniformed and masked workers.

dialogues.speaker: DETAINED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am a Dutch citizen and I want to be taken to my Embassy. You have no right to do this. People give him a wide berth. Orantes keeps going.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mission control set-up to monitor the progress of the disease. Screens cover the local news in different cities Different parts of the room are dedicated to different regions of the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a glass walled conference room, Cheever surveys a whit board covered in marker. A diagram of what we know so far Minneapolis, Chicago, London, Hong Kong, Dubai and beyond dotted lines connecting places and names. It‘s spreading like a blood stain on the map. Cheever’s cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m still here...What‘s the news saying? He looks at the butcher paper flow chart-- eyes Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t know about Tamiflu yet. Yeah, we have samples from Chicago. I don't know...Get some saline spray for your nose. You still eating leftovers? Yeah...I think New Year’s in Mexico sounds good. Where is. Daniel’s place? Hextall walks in, grim look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: The Japan sample matches the Minnesota samples. The WHO says they have a match with the London cluster. We're level four and headed to level five.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: {into phone) Babe, I’1]l call you later. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired man in his late 40's comes out of the science building. His name is DR. IAN SUSSMAN-- he speaks into a dictaphone. He is unaware of this but ALAN KRUMWIEDE is a few steps behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN .
dialogues.text: {into a tape recorder) Shows novel characteristics and looks mosaic in origin. All attempts to grow the virus on tissue have failed...

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I knew it was a mosaic. It‘s Godzilla, King Kong and Frankenstein all in one. He recognizes Krumwiede.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: Fuck, really? Get away from here, Alan. ‘You're not a doctor and you‘re not a reporter.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: IT am a reporter. Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: Blogging isn’t writing.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: (getting angry) There are rumors that it’s a biological weapon-- have you spoken to USAMRIID?

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: Go away, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: It’s getting on planes, it's going to museums, you always said in_ class when medical people are dying it‘s time to be scared. The nurses’ union in Minneapolis is raising ethical issues-- they’re staying home. Tamiflu doesn’t do shit this time. We’re naked.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you remember anything from class, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I’ve been following it online since the Marunouchi Man-- it's 25% fatal. Small Pox numbers. The nightinare cometh.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: The nightmare is online, Alan. The nightmare is you. Get away from my lab. Sussman gets in his Prius and drives away. INT. MEARS’ HOTEL ROOM - MINNEAPOLIS - MORNING Mears wakes up to the sound of her own cough. She doesn’t give it much thought, but as she sits up the force of the headache hits. She rushes to the bathroom and grabs a battery powered thermometer from her toiletries bag. Hands shaking she pu it in her mouth. Sits on the toilet scared out of her min

dialogues.speaker: MEARS
dialogues.text: {with thermometer in mouth) Please god, please god. She checks the thermometer. It‘s high. Mears rips into a package of Tamiflu. She takes a pill and swallows with water.

dialogues.speaker: MEARS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No...no...no... She opens the drapes and looks outside~- another gray day Minnesota. But, today is different THE NATIONAL GUARD is out. She picks up the phone and calls the front desk. MEARS (CONT’D) This is Dr. Erin Mears in 318. I want to know the name of everyone who has serviced this room in the last few days...Also, you need to get in touch with the waitress who was working in the lounge last night. I need all of their numbers,..Yes...It’s an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORANTES wears a spacesuit and interviews THE OLD WOMAN fr the elevator at Chrysanthemum Gardens. Everything goes through a TRANSLATOR (male, 30's). TWO CHINESE HEALTH OFFICIALS ‘sit in. All wear protective gear. One we will come to know as Orantes’ CHINESE COUNTERPART.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: In the fall we try and eat an animal. One with a good coat. They say it protects you...A civet or another strong animal that gives you strong wind.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: And did you eat such an animal this year?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: No. I could not. afford it. That's why I‘m sick. Just the chicken from the wet market. I tried to buy more vinegar for the children-- but it’s all sold out. Everyone is sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chinese health official discusses the findings with Ora and the Translator. He switches back and forth between English and Chinese with the other officials in the room.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: There are 37 from Chrysanthemum who have symptoms. Ten have died.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Are there any other clusters? In Kowloon? In Hong Kong proper? What about on the mainland? An animated conversation breaks out in Chinese. Orantes tries to keep track, but clearly they do not want her to part of it. The men gesticulate at the flow chart on the wall. The Chinese Health Official calms his cohorts.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE HEALTH OFFICIAL 2
dialogues.text: We have nothing on the mainland to report. Orantes isn’t sure if she should believe this.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: What about the Macau cluster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTAGION 1/14/10 °63.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE HEALTH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: It is possible that this Japanese index patient brought it from Thailand. We have heard rumors of a new virus there in the North.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Perhaps you would like to go. to the hotel now. We will arrange a meal for later and you can tour the other hospitals. She studies the flow chart on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: I want to go to Macau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff and his daughter, Jory, search the aisles for item Emhoff asks a SALES CLERK for help.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: They’re out of them over at the Walgreens. The N-95 is the one the website says is the most protective.

dialogues.speaker: SALES CLERK
dialogues.text: We don’t carry anything like that-- I think you want to go over to a medical supply store or something.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: We tried that place on Lyndale. They're out as well. What about one for working with hazardous chemicals...If you were sanding something. A mask like that?

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: You want me to wear one of those around? Really? Maybe I’m immune like you.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: People do it in Japan all the time, Jory. The sales clerk leads them over to the aisle where the ma might be. They're also sold out.

dialogues.speaker: SALES CLERK
dialogues.text: Must of sold out of these this morning.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: What if 1 just wear a bandana like Jesse James?

dialogues.speaker: SALES CLERK
dialogues.text: Is there anything else I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Flashlight, duct tape and some water purification tablets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A video-conference call in progress. Leopold and a host o other Doctors from the WHO convene with officials at the Cheever, Haggerty and others. There are also officials fr China, Japan and the UK on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: We have clusters in London, Manchester, Dubai, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Kyoto, Chicago, Minneapolis, Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, Boston, and Macau. This morning we have learned of suspected cases in Amsterdam. and Frankfurt. We have met the criteria for level four.

dialogues.speaker: APRICAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Depending on samples from the cases in Pretoria it may be level five. They all came from London. A map. of the world is broadcast to all the representativ The charge of the virus is alarming. It spools out over time.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: Using our models we believe there are approximately 89,000 cases at this point and that we are heading toward 267,000-- and from there using our model based on the R naught of 3.2, here: is where we expect to be in 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Map animates to reflect this rate of spread-- exponen increases pool out. Over a million cases around the world LEOPOLD (CONT’D) The fatality rate is 26.3 per cent.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We are not prepared to connect the Macau casino cases with the ones in Kowloon at this point-- I think we need to wait for analysis of the samples.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: But, my understanding is that there is considerable traffic between the two...

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Yes. But, we should wait for the science.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: We have an epidemiologist on the ground in Hong Kong-- her work in determining the origins of the outbreak is crucial. Once we know where this thing came from, we can get about the business of solving it.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We are cooperating fully. In the CDC video conference room, Cheever, Haggerty and Hextall smirk at this.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: Dr. Cheever-- perhaps you can update us on the research. An image of THE VIRUS is broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: We believe it is a paramyxovirus. We know that it is transmitted easily by respiration and believe it also can live on surfaces for up to 24 hours. As of right now, nobody has been able to grow the virus in cells.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: Because it kills all the cells we put it in. Pig, chicken and human. Until we can grow enough of it we can’t vaccinate against it.

dialogues.speaker: JAPANESE OFFICIAL, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Have you found any treatment at all? Any antivirals? Anything Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We've begun studies with the survivors, but that’s going to take some time.

dialogues.speaker: PRENCH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I think it is important te discuss issues of patent and distribution now-- I know there are conversations in progress between pharmaceutical companies...

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: WHO is encouraging the sharing of information between the private and public sector.

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: As of an hour ago there weren’t even any test monkeys available. Someone's cornered the market...There are reports on the internet that Relenza is effective.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: No doubt started by the makers of Relenza.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: That is not our experience.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Obviously, if someone has discovered a treatment protocol we would like full disclosure and a commitment to forfeit patents and share revenues. 66.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I don't know if we are prepared to agree with that right now in a blanket statement. BRITISH OFFICIAL... Not until we know if we are. talking therapy or vaccine. Too many unknowns.

dialogues.speaker: JAPANESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: But, we know one in four or five will die.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I think we need to hear first from the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Dr. Leopold, but I don’t see the point in arguing about who gets the rights to a cure that doesn’t even exist yet.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Maybe it does exist. That’s why we need disclosure.

dialogues.speaker: JAPANESE BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: I think we all would like an answer to that question. What is US policy on sharing medicine with the rest of the world? Cheever and Haggerty share a look. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: We are awaiting a decision on this matter from Homeland Security and other departments of our government. I think there are important legal issues here for all of us. .

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: So, there will be no full disclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Capitol Building on a fall day. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SENATOR BOXER discusses the emerging situation with her s and some other INTERESTED PARTIES, BOXER . We've got 50 different statés.with 50 different policies, we’ve got cbc, HHS, FEMA-

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSIONAL AID
dialogues.text: They’re all Homeland Security now.

dialogues.speaker: BOXER
dialogues.text: So who sets policy? We've got 500 phone calls from San Francisco on just this. Where’s Martin? We need to issue a statement.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSIONAL AID
dialogues.text: He left after the breakfast--~ looked like he was coming down with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mears lies in a bed in a long row of beds in the makeshif infirmary. Swanson approaches in protective gear-

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Dr. Mears, Dr. Cheever called again. We’re just having a very hard time with the logistics of evacuating you. Finding a plane and all-- Mears nods-- she’s miserable.

dialogues.speaker: MEARS
dialogues.text: There’s nothing we can do anyway, might as well do it here as in Atlanta. Swanson hands her a phone in a plastic bag. SWANSON. I did get your phone. Dr. Cheever asked that you call if you feel up to it.

dialogues.speaker: MEARS
dialogues.text: I’m having word finding problems. Sensitive to light. Same things Emhoff reported. SWANSON eno first responders and medical personnel at the University. I want to move you there, but the nurses’ union is calling a stoppage until protocols are in place. There are volunteers and nuns-- it’s hard to know where’s the best place. Mears nods-- sweaty and miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes and her Chinese Counterpart wander through the Ca with a MAINLAND MAINTENANCE WORKER. Very few gamblers are present. She is escorted as always by other Chinese Healt Officials and CASINO MANAGEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: MAINLAND
dialogues.text: First there were two who got sick. Then there were many more and now everyone is sick or sleeping outside. Now, so many people.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Do you remember who got the first headache?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: We know that Sun Ke and Zou Lufeng became ill on the same day.

dialogues.speaker: MAINLAND
dialogues.text: Yes, they did. And then Chen Nanxi when he moved into Li Bai‘s bunk.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: What happened to Li Bai? He was resistant?

dialogues.speaker: MAINLAND
dialogues.text: He went on vacation-- before. Orantes scratches his name off a list.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: That’s why he is not among the sick.

dialogues.speaker: MATNLAND
dialogues.text: He died anyway though. An accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: MAINLAND
dialogues.text: He went to see his sister and was killed in an accident-- but, it. was before Sun Ke and Zou Lufeng got sick.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Where did his sister live?

dialogues.speaker: MAINLAND
dialogues.text: Kowloon. Orantes goes back and circles his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An even more. extensive series of rooms within rooms~- gl cubes connected by air-locks. In the innermost area a BEN SCIENTIST works with the VIRUS-- slides are moved from machine to machine. Its most basic composition appears on computer screen TWO ROOMS OVER. HEXTALL and EISENBERG review the results. A short alphabe displayed before them like a high stakes game of scrabble A,C,T and G.

dialogues.speaker: EISENBERG
dialogues.text: (off the screen) Part pig, part human and part bat. Maybe Nipah or Hendra viruses.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: Did the Emhoff woman have any evidence of a bat bite in the autopsy? Another set of results appears on the screen. A bell curv wavers from right tc left.

dialogues.speaker: EISENBERG
dialogues.text: It's still changing. The swarm is shifting every few days. Could still mutate in a major way. HEXTALL _—_ It’s figuring us out faste¥.-than we’re figuring it out.

dialogues.speaker: EISENBERG
dialogues.text: It doesn’t have anything else to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheever and a host of other.workers monitor screens and answer phones. The map on the wall shows the virus has spread exponentially. Butcher paper spans the area-- but can’t wrap this up in butcher paper anymore. They’ve run of walls. Haggerty walks into the center.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Ellis, Can I borrow you for a moment? INT. HAGGERTY’S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER Haggerty and Cheever behind closed doors.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: There’s a sick congressman from Illinois in Dc. He just got back from Chicago. The governor there is gonna call out the National Guard and try and do some isolation. They‘re closing Midway and O’Hare. Some rumor on the goddamn internet about it being in the water.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: That’s gonna make it hard to get people to wash their hands.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: The WHO is taking it to five in an hour. The secret service is moving the President underground. Congress is figuring out how to work online. It’s fucking surreal. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When word goes out there’s gonna be a run on the banks, the grocery stores, gas stations. Cheever nods. He can see implications in the shaded maps the walls.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: It’s all gonna tip over. Virus'1ll be the least of our problems.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Let's just make sure nobody knows until everybody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes and her CHINESE COUNTERPART work backwards agains time. Butcher paper up.on- the wall. A diagram with boxes and names. And a map with pins in it.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: We have Emhoff at the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong. We have Marunouchi Man at the Golden Dragon...We have Khalifa and Irina on a helicopter that landed in Macau. All on the 15th of November.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Li Bai had contact with Khalifa and took it to Kowloon where Emhoff was a tourist. Khalifa could have dispersed it-- he may have vaccinated himself somehow. I think we still have to consider the possibility that it is a biological weapon...Or Marunouchi Man brought it from Thailand.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: The first cluster in Thailand was on the 27th. It didn’t start there. She crosses to the window locks out.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Do we believe the Thai ministry is a reliable reporter?

dialogues.speaker: HONG KONG
dialogues.text: A plume of dark smoke rises in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: What are they burning?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: The dogs-- health minister says they could be transmitters. It has to be considered. Orantes goes back to the diagram.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (prelap) When you have a virus your body sends out armies of antibodies. And the antibodies look at the virus and compare it to every virus you've ever had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheever paces and stares out at the sea of press standing vigil beyond the gates. He’s on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: .-And it figures out how it beat it the last time. You are your own pharmaceutical company-- you’re born with a catalogue of cures. The problem is sometimes, there is no last time. It doesn‘t know the answer. Every fifty years or so somebody has to go first.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How many people are gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: In 1918, about one percent of the population died from the Spanish Flu outbreak. 40 million. INT. AUBREY’S APARTMENT - CHICAGO. - INTERCUT

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: But, we’re better now. We have drugs we didn‘t have and better science. So it won’t be that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something faster.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: It used to spread only as fast as we could walk. Now it gets on planes and goes 500 miles an hour. We live in cities. Hang from straps on subways. It wants us in schools and elevators. Shaking hands...Mears is sick in Minneapolis.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: The Doc I sent up there-- she’s on a cot at an armory. There are no nurses.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: There’s a strike.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: How can they do that?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Because there’s nothing they can do- - we're just putting healthy people. next to sick ones. There are still people dying of cancer and strokes today and tomorrow. We need them there.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry, Ellis. That’s not your fault. You went places, too. You took risks. It’s random. in Cheever unravels at this-- he starts talking

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I want you to get in your car and drive here. Drive by yourself. They're gonna close the airport and the banks are gonna go to shit. There’s only enough food in supermarkets for 3 days. It’s gonna get difficult in a lot of ways and it’s gonna start soon. .

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Get as much cash as you can out of the ATM. Get across state lines and don’t tell anyone. Just get in your car now. He hangs up. From behind a pillar emerges ROGER the JANIT

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear any of that?

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: I got people, too, Dr.. Cheever. We all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black sedan pulls up to the house. A man in a suit gets out of the car and walks to the door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff and Jory sit in the kitchen and work on their computers. The news provides a steady stream of flu updat and school closings. The doorbell rings. Emhoff goes to answer it. He doesn't recognize the man an hesitates to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: EMROFF
dialogues.text: Uh...Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: Stuart Booth. I’m looking for Thomas Emhoff.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: I’m Tom Emhoff. Do I know you, Mr. Booth?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: Mr. Emhoff, I'm a lawyer and I want to discuss with you what could be incredibly lucrative.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFP
dialogues.text: An offer? What kind of offer.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: May I come in? I’d need you to sign something before I can disclose all the details. Emhoff considers-- beyond Booth a TOWN CAR idles in the driveway. —

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I flew in privately this morning to meet you Mr. Emhoff-- I’d really appreciate a chance to make my presentation. INT. DOMINICK’S GROCERY CHICAGO - NIGHT Aubrey is stocking up on provisions-- she has filled her with WATER, CLIFF BARS, CANS OF TUNA, BANANAS-- she stand front of the display for PURELL. She takes as many bottle can fit in the cart. She gets in line-~ ANOTHER SHOPPER clocks her cart curiou Aubrey struggles against the desire to share what she kno

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aubrey drives down the freeway-- NATIONAL GUARD trucks mo in the other direction toward the city. SEMI-TRUCKS stand parked on the shoulder front to back for a mile. She heads south. Her phone rings-- her friend from Thanksgiving dinner.

dialogues.speaker: NYGAARD, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: Hey, friend what's up with blowing off dinner?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: NYGAARD
dialogues.text: Sorry? Why so flaky You feel OK? This flu shit is really spooky. What does Ellis say? Facebook says it‘s a terrorist. thing and that they’re keeping the antidote until demands are met.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Uh...He says it’s serious. Nygaard‘s daughter cries in the background.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 77.

dialogues.speaker: NYGAARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey, shush...What does that mean? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I’m getting out of town.

dialogues.speaker: NYGAARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What? What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I’m going to tell you something and you’re not going to repeat it. And so it spreads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff and Booth. Emhoff reads a non-disclosure agreement

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: You want to buy my antibodies?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: We want to have an antiserum on hand for private use. The scientists we are working with believe they can generate small quantities in their lab.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: You want to pay me a million dollars for my blood?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: There are other survivors, Mr. Emhoff, but because of the publicity around your wife it was easy to find you.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFP
dialogues.text: And who would get it?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: It would be kept for my client‘s private use. The contract states that it would not be for commercial gain or manufacture-~ not a vaccine mind you, an antiserum. It would be a very limited quantity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: May I ask who your client is?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, that’s confidential. We are offering you a million dollars for two pints of blood. We-Sispect others will explore this avenue. and that at some point the courts will become involved. This offer is only good for today. There's a registered nurse in the car outside with the necessary equipment.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: In the backseat sits the REGISTERED NURSE in question.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: (off his daughter in the next room) However many doses you were going to make, could you make one more?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but that would raise issues of indemnification and other sorts of exposure. You won the genetic lottery Mr. Emhoff-- we‘re here to help you cash in your ticket. If you don’t want to, we’1ll find another winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff weighs his options,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth gets into the car and drives away. No deal.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: Who's next? The Nurse looks at a list.

dialogues.speaker: RN
dialogues.text: 1121 Wills Place.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE: We see the Virus replicate over and over agai cells on a monitor. It’s exponential charge across the sl is consuming. . Sussman replays the image over and over again. A group of COHORTS share a glass of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: To cancerous pig cells.

dialogues.speaker: CDC ROOM
dialogues.text: Hextall, Eisenberg, Cheever, Haggerty and others-- see th same image. A small victory.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: First they have to figure out how to grow it.

dialogues.speaker: WHO CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: So do Leopold and his counterparts.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s been three weeks now-- but they’1l figure it out eventually.

dialogues.speaker: A CONFERENCE ROOM IN FRANCE
dialogues.text: So do Scientists at AVENTIS. A large logo on their wall.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: And then everyone will start growing it.

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE ROOMS IN NYC/LONDON/MOSCOW
dialogues.text: Every drug company in the world strobes by -- all looking the same image.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then the race is on. They‘1l be growing it in every lab on earth. And that's a bad day to be a Rhesus Macaque Monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MORGAN ISLAND, OFF SOUTH CAROLINA — DAY We see a Rhesus monkey coaxed into a cage. and carried aw

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: They're endangered in India—-~- already. And this'll probably’ finish them off. He is loaded on a truck with other monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The US has an Island off of South Carolina where we raise them for just this kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: INT, BROKERAGE
dialogues.text: Krunwiede sits wearing an N-95 mask speaking to a broker. Most of the offices are empty.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: The Rhesus was in space before us, and it’ll get the vaccine before us.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STANLEY
dialogues.text: And how long will that take?

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Hard to say. Months. The FDA will fast track it. But, there’s always a chance the virus could mutate-~ tomorrow or the next day and then we’rxe starting all over.

dialogues.speaker: MCRGAN STANLEY
dialogues.text: All the Pharma stocks are already through the roof. Are you suggesting we invest in Monkeys? He chuckles... Krumwiede is offended.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: You're familiar with Forsythia?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STANLEY
dialogues.text: Can’t say that T am. Is that a medicine?

dialogues.speaker: . KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: It’s an herb-- the Chinese have used it for years. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have various sources in the medical community both here and abroad so what I am about to tell you is backed up by tests that will be out shortly in peer reviewed journals. There are two manufacturers of Forsythi to invest in both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “~T want He hands Morgan Stanley a slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STANLEY
dialogues.text: What does Forsythia do?

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: It’s the cure. And a cure is a lot more useful than vaccine if you’re already sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trench is being dug by a BACK HOE. Adjacent to it is another trench lined with THE DEAD. WORKERS from the STAT HEALTH DEPARTMENT wear protective gear and keep track of bodies and where they have been laid. Quantity begins to trump compassion now. Swanson appears with some PLASTIC FLOWERS. He sees MEARS’ body in the mass grave. It is covered with BLUE PLASTIC SHEETING-- it flaps in the wind. He puts in the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSCN
dialogues.text: When did we run out of body bags?

dialogues.speaker: MORGUE WORKER
dialogues.text: Last week. Trying to get some from Canada. Was over at the crematorium this morning-- it’s all backed up. Workers are afraid to come in. Average day maybe a hundred people die-- we‘re expecting twice that today. Ground is frozen. An EARTH MOVER begins to fill in the trench. INT. HOTEL CONFERENCE ROOM -— DAY Orantes walks in. Her COUNTERPART is having a very animat conversation in Chinese. Pictures of BAI, IRINA, KHALIFA MARUNOUCHI MAN are still on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: What is it? What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: The American woman used an ATM at the Golden Dragon...Bank of America just confirmed with her statefient. The CIA has shared this with us. ORANTES . Was she there the same night as Khalifa and Irina?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Yes. Bai was working as well. Orantes puts Emhoff’s picture on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: I want to see the Casino security footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bridge over the St. Croix River is patrolled by the NATIONAL GUARD on both sides. Cars are backed up in both directions from checkpoints. Searchlights sweep the bare trees on. both sides of the river-- they find people head east. EMHOFF’S CAR AT THE CHECKPOINT Jory sits in the backseat. A GUARDSMAN in protective gear stops the car by some cones. He uses a megaphone. Keeps h distance.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: There is no crossing to Wisconsin at this time by order of the governor of Wisconsin. An order of quarantine has been issued in accordance with the state of emergency... Emhoff rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: {yelling back) i want to get my daughter out. We're not sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the Guardsman can’t hear him above the honking and r wash of a BLACKHAWK HELO. Emhoff gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I already had it. Get back in your car, Sir. Keep fifteen feet away. EMHOFF (CONT‘D)~ I had it already. I want to get her out of here-- there’s no nurses. We hear there’s more food there, and medical care. We have family in Madison.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Get back in that car, sir and turn it around. Or we will arrest you.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: And take me where? Where will you put all of us? Down on the river a JET SKI is making a run for the Wisco side of the river‘in the cold water. TWO FIGURES ON THE J SKI...one falls off and the Jet Ski doubles back. Guardsm on the Wisconsin side pour into the trees with flashlight and weapons. Emhoff gets back in the car. Joins the traffic headed bac to Minneapolis.

dialogues.speaker: INT, TV STUDIO
dialogues.text: Krumwiede sits there checking his iPhone madly. A CAMERAM stands 25 feet away.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: Anything you can tell me off the record?

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: You should buy some forsythia. Enough for you and everyone you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheever sits, mic-ed up with ANDERSON COOPER on a make sh set outside the cDCc.

dialogues.speaker: COCPER
dialogues.text: There are stories.on the internet that in India and elsewhere ribavirin has been shown to be effective in the treatment of the virus-- but Homeland Security. has asked the CDC not tc make. any’ announcements until stockpiles of the drug can be secured.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: There are ongoing evaluations of a number of drugs-- ribavirin is one of them. So far our best. defense is social distancing.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: And do we have enough ribavirin for everyone in America?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Right now there are ten million doses. But, we don’t want to send people out searching for something that may not be effective...

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: If there are 200 million of us-- who gets it?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: We are currently in the process of prioritizing-~ starting with first responders, health care providers and other officials.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: We‘d like to bring Alan Krumwiede into the debate...Alan is a freelance journalist who was one of the first to track the story of the Marunouchi Man video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krumwiede listens through an ear piece.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 “85.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: On Twitter this morning, you stated the truth about the virus has ‘been kept from the world by the WHO and cbc to allow for the “friends of the current administration to- benefit from it both financially and physically.”

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: This is the result of government being involved in health care. There are therapies that we know are effective right now-- like Forsythia-- and they do not even appear on the CDC website. Because the friends of the administration don’t control forsythia.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You also say that the World Health Organization is in bed with the pharmaceutical companies.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Because they are. That's who stands to gain from this. CHEEVER : i The CDC has explored forsythia and other alleged homeopathic treatments, there’s just no science to back up these claims. We are ruling nothing out-- people are sick and dying and we are doing everything we can to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Dr. Cheever is being a bit disingenuous here.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: The WHO and the Chinese are working very hard to figure out where this virus came from and once we know that it will be much easier to treat it. To gét sick you need to come in contact with a sick person or something they touched-- to get scared all you need to do is come in contact with a rumor or a TV or the internet. Mr. Krumwiede is spreading misinformation even faster than the virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krumwiede. seethes.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Really. That‘s funny. Because if you look.on Twitter there is a communique attributed te Dr,_.- Cheever by Elizabeth Nygaard~aébout the quarantine of Chicago. hours before it was announced to the public. So, that’s why i say he is disingenuous when he talks about equal care for all.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: These are some pretty wild allegations here-- can you tell us what information appeared on Twitter and when? What is your relationship to Elizabeth Nygaard? Cheever is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I’m not aware of anything attributed to me-

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: It’s pretty clear that Homeland Security and CDC and Health and Human Services and FEMA and the Army have their own agenda here. These things, they go two, four, eight, sixteen and you think you’ve got it in front of you-- but then it’s 256 and then it’s 65,000 and it's behind you and above you and all around you. And that’s where it is now. Whoever let the genie out of the bottle isn't gonna put it back in...They can’t now. INT. BOOTS PHARMACY —- LONDON — EVENING A long line of people reaches. out the door and down the street. A BOOTS EMPLOYEE counts the people in line. BOooTs .+.-Forty eight, forty nine, fifty. Beyond the fifty people are at least another TWO HUNDRED folks. Someone in the back of the pack begins to cough.

dialogues.speaker: LINE STANDER
dialogues.text: Cover your mouth, brother.

dialogues.speaker: COUGHER
dialogues.text: Eh, fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTS -
dialogues.text: We will only be able to give out fifty courses today-- that’s our forsythia allotment... The crowd reacts. There’s pushing.

dialogues.speaker: LINE STANDER WITH DREADS
dialogues.text: You're keeping them, aren’t you? Driving up the price? It’s getting ugly. A TOUGH AND HIS GIRL push toward the front. THE TOUGH’S GIRL (sotto to Boots Employee-- offering money) We have a little one at home.

dialogues.speaker: COUGHER
dialogues.text: We all. have little ones and money--— park it back,: bitch. And with that a melee ensues. Store displays are turned over. People make mad grabs for the herbs. Some climb ove the counter. The Pharmacist clutches the packets and tries to lock the door. The CROWD ransacks the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of cages filled with RHESUS MONKEYS. Workers in hea protective gear survey.. Each cage is numbered with the corresponding vaccine. Trial and error. The confused monkey faces stare into the camera. They're our astronauts again. TWO MONKEYS are not moving-- they are removed. FLASHBACK - INT. GOLDEN DRAGON CASINO -— MACAU Tt’s the night in question. Beth Emhoff stands with her c workers near a FISH-PRAWN-CRAB TABLE.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 88. A traditional Chinese dice game. The Marunouchi Man gathe up the dice and throws them. People laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BETH -
dialogues.text: I don’t understand this game at all,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her host laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE HOST
dialogues.text: It's Fish Prawn Crab.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I want to try. She maneuvers through the crowd toward the Marunouchi Man He gathers up the dice for another throw. Rubs them together. He says something in Japanese and holds the dic out toward Beth. BETH (CONT’D) What? She moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: THE IMAGE CHANGES
dialogues.text: It’s the security image on a CCTV. Beth Emhoff leans into the frame and BLOWS ON THE DICE. The Marunouchi Man rubs dice in his hands and tosses them across the table. It rewinds and plays again. Breath. Transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes is watching the image on a monitor. Stacks of DVD surround her, Other CHINESE OFFICIALS watch other monitor She crosses to her CHINESE COUNTERPART. ORANTES. It didn’t come from Thailand. She hands the dise to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Maybe it came from America.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: She was in Hong Kong five days before that. It’s here. It came from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff and Jory pick away at the ice-- four inches thick. Scattered across the frozen lake, other groups are gather around exposed holes and in small shacks. Ice fishing. They break through to open water. Jory puts a kernel of canned corn on a hook and drops it into the water. A NEW WOMAN appears and begins to struggle with a hatchet the ice. Jory watches her. A small celebration breaks out at another hole-- a fish h been caught.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: {shouting toward the celebration) What are you using for bait? Nothing back.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you using over there? They talk amongst themselves.

dialogues.speaker: FISHERMAN
dialogues.text: (shouting back) We need milk? You. have any milk? The HATCHET WOMAN pauses. Shouting.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN
dialogues.text: Cows are dying-~ I saw them by St. Cloud. People are afraid. No milk. We‘re eating the dog’s food... Her voice breaks.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Dad. ~-

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: What? He studies the woman for a moment-- failing at the ice.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: Help her. Emhoff walks toward the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK? She drops to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET . WOMAN
dialogues.text: Our pilot light went out and I can’t figure out how to start it again. There’s gas in the house.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN
dialogues.text: Orono.

dialogues.speaker: EMEOFF
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him mistrustfully.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My daughter and I-- we‘re fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CHEEVER’S APARTMENT - LATE NIGHT Aubrey sits in the living room. Tension in the air. Cheev cocks some rice and beans in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I told her not to say anything Ellis, I did. I've trusted her my entire life. I’ve told her a thousand things she never repeated.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: We’re messy little animals. We lick our fingers and turn the page. We rub cur eyes and eat the peanuts out of the communal bowl, We spread everything around. I did. You did. We can’t keep anything to ourselves. Our spit, our secrets.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I’m trying to explain-

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: You have to admire the virus-- it climbs inside a cell and changes it. We can’t even do that ourselves. We're just six billion rough drafts. We're the most dangerous thing that ever happened to each other.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: She’s like my sister, I’m the god mother to that little girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: A hundred people were killed in shootings in Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: And maybe a hundred people we know weren’t there to die.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I asked you not to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You think other people aren't giving their loved ones information first? You think it’s a level playing field? If a boat was sinking who would you put on the life raft, Ellis? Us, our family and friends or strangers? It’s survival of the fittest-- and being fit has a lot to do with who’s on your speed dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a full PROTECTIVE SUIT sits on a bench alone. We can see through his mask that it’s KRUMWIEDE. He waits fo lab door to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrourided by NATIONAL GUARDSMAN as security. They walk toward a black SUV. He’s precious cargo.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: The monkeys will take too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sussman keeps walking.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 92. Sussman pauses. Tired and angry, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: Go home, Alan. And lie to people about mutations and herbs. Go home.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I have sick friends.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: We all do.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Let me go first, Dr. Sussman. People trust me.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: Go home, Alan. Tell people to wash their hands and to cover their mouths when they cough.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I feel very hot today. Three days ago I went to a rally.

dialogues.speaker: SUSSMAN
dialogues.text: You're hot because you’re wearing that suit. Sussman gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff, Jory and THE HATCHET WOMAN enter the house. It is cold and dark.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN
dialogues.text: I tried to light it but I was afraid there was gas in the house. And nobody would come and help me. It‘1l be Christmas in a few days and nobedy cares. There’s a tree in the next room-- a couple stockings hung over the fireplace. Jory clocks them. Pauses. Emhoff gets down on the ground with a book of matches. He hears a GROAN from another room followed by a cough.

dialogues.speaker: GROAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rebecca? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emhoff sits up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: I thought you said you were alone?

dialogues.speaker: GROAN, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Rebecca?? sere

dialogues.speaker: JORY EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Dad- Jory get out of here-- don’t touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN
dialogues.text: He’s dying and I’m going to die too. I have a fever. Jory scrambles toward the door-- her scarf over her face. Hatchet woman grabs at Emhoff.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Feel my head. Nobody answers when you call 911. The car is almost out of gas. Emhoff£ looks out the window. Jory is safely outside. He his hand on the woman’s head. She shudders at human conta

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFP
dialogues.text: I can’t really tell. Do you have a thermometer? Hatchet woman nods and goes to the drawer to find it. Emh gets back to the pilot light.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHET WOMAN
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you afraid like everyone else? He wonders if it’s safe to admit his immunity. He decides against it.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFP
dialogues.text: I‘m just not.

dialogues.speaker: PLACES
dialogues.text: Leopold holds court over the group. A screen full of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: Before we start, I just want to mention that we have been having infrastructure problems with our communications system and we may lose some of you during toda briefing--~ please bear with” Also, the Portuguese translator is in isolation. Dr. Haggerty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggerty, Cheever and Hextall.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Thank ‘you, Director Lecpold.. We are no longer tracking case numbers as we are discouraging people who are symptomatic from contacting medical providers. In short, we need to keep the hospitals open for the people we can help-—

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: This is not our policy. We continue to treat: everyone.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: To what end? :

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: To the end that it decreases panic \ for people to know that doctors will see them. Because it's humane.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: We respectfully disagree.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Our models show we should anticipate one-in-fifteen people on the planet will contract Macau Encephalitis Virus or MEV-1. Higher in urban areas. The mortality rate fluctuates between 19 and 26 percent depending on underlying medical condition and other socioeconomic issues--— nutrition and fresh water.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 95.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: It is near 30 percent here. We are burning bodies. We have limited essential services. ee

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: The Cambridge Study suggests that we can anticipate anything over a five percent infection rate and ten percent mortality will cause major social breakdowns. Ten percent is the tipping point. And this is how it looks in the world...

dialogues.speaker: ARGENTINIAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: It will be more pervasive in the Southern Hemisphere in the coming months. We are seeing hoarding, : peopie heading to isolated areas.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: That's better than having them in buses and trains.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDISH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We are continuing to experiment with other drugs-- sedatives, anticonvulsives. They might buy time.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: There are some reports of inducing a coma and ventilating victims. Hard to tell if the results are better than placebo.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: And what if you don’t have 100 million ventilators?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Do any of you think we are prepared to share before taking care of our own?

dialogues.speaker: LEOPCLD
dialogues.text: We should be governed by need, not self-interest.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: And we should only sleep with our wives and return the wallets that we find on the street-- but we are not se perfect.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: We have asked the UN to plan manufacturing and distribution of a : virus once it is available. | i 1 THE NYSE/MOSQUE/MALL OF AMERICA/HYDE PARK/ST. MARK‘S |

dialogues.speaker: BEXTALL .
dialogues.text: There are rumors in the scientific comminity that the Russians are testing vaccines on prisoners-- it is unethical and brutal.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: And what should we test on? We're out of monkeys. We are not trying to save laboratory mice--~ we are trying to save people.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: And did the US not test anthrax vaccine on its Army? Is that not unethical?

dialogues.speaker: US OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I think that’s different. We were trying to protect our military.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 97. IRANIAN OFFICIAL. And if you are safe from anthrax are the rest of us safe from you?

dialogues.speaker: US OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I don’t see how this is productive. We have been a leader in sha: our resources with the entire world.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITOL BUILDING IN DC
dialogues.text: Underneath his image they say-- “PROPHET OR PROFIT?”

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: I think we need to remain focussed on containment and buying time for the science.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: And the sharing of responsible science.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH OFFICIAL INDIAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: You can't rely on the free We would still like to begin market to motivate people and discussions of reparations then complain that with the Chinese. competition causes someone to lose.

dialogues.speaker: JAPANESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: As would we. The picture starts clipping-- satellite problems. Some countries break off. .

dialogues.speaker: US OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We would like to continue a conversation with G10 countries off- line about freezing markets. The picture clips some more. Leopold is gone.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: I think we lost them.

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: India is still here...

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: So is Spain.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: If the Index Patient is an American Business Woman or Arab Nationai-- er a Japanese Tourist, how are we to blame? Who do you sue for an earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK -— INT. GOLDEN DRAGON CASINO - NIGHT Beth demurs a drink and leaves the Fish-Prawn-Crab table.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Whew...I need to use the loo. Anybody know where it is? One of her CHINESE HOSTS points across the casino. Beth off. She ts a little sweaty and clammy. As she walks sh checks her purse and takes out a digital camera. She take picture of the flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s early and Orantes is still pouring over CCTV footage from the Casino.

dialogues.speaker: BETH ON A MONTTOR
dialogues.text: She enters the LADIES’ ROOM and stands at the sink. She stares at herself in the mirror for a moment. And dabs hi finger in a pot of LIP GLOSS. As she. does, IRINA emerges from the stall behind her... The two women stand next to each other at the sink. Irin searches her purse for something.

dialogues.speaker: IRINA
dialogues.text: Shit, T left mine in the room. Beth offers hers.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Not sure if it’s your shade. They share the lip gloss.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE FRAME ON THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Orantes leans back. The moment of infection. She looks at the flow chart of transmission. 8. sets e Sa er a up

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Emhoff gave it to the model. The model gave it to Khalifa. It isn’t a weapon. I read the work reports. Bai cleaned that bathroom an hour later when his shift started.: He was likely exposed. oe

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: They say the French and Americans have a cure. They are manufacturing it in secret. WHO knows, but they are in bed with the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Who says?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Blogger on the internet.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: You don't believe that, do you? Chinese Counterpart shrugs. He nods. He nods. the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How is your mother?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: We tried forsythia. But, she didn’t. make'it. There's a mass grave on Lantau.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘m going to go out for a run. We need to know where Emhoff was before the casino. Orantes leaves. .The Chinese Counterpart picks up He looks out the window. Someone answers on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE COUNTERPART
dialogues.text: Yes, now. I’11 want to be included.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes goes for a run. She wears a mask and gloves. It’s erisp morning in Hong Kong. Not much traffic. The city is primarily shut down. A few high end sedans. A few militar vehicles. Everyone wears a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOME OF THE AFFLICTED are huddled together around trash c fires. Bundles of food are left for them. Orantes steers clear of them. Orantes turns a corner and a VAN does the same. It slows Match her pace. She speeds up. So does the van. She turns a corner. The van does, too. The window rolls down.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Dr. Orantes, you're needed back at the hotel. There‘s a call from Geneva.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: The ministry sent me. We're targets in the official vehicles~- sorry to frighten you. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: How did you know. where to find me?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Many of us are looking. She remains suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: I’il run back now. She turns and starts back toward the hotel. She is just a few feet away when the back of the van opens. THREE ARMED MEN IN BALACLAVAS get out and give chase. Orantes runs. But, they are on her and force her to the ground. Her mask gets sideways in the fall. She turns her face away from HER ATTACKERS dodging their breath and swe Hands and faces and germs. She turns her face to the pavement and curls in a-ball. T pick her up and drag her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes is thrown in the back. She is cuffed to the frame the compartment. The cuffs scratch her wrist opening up a small wound. She sees a new point of entry on her body opening to a world full of danger.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You are the news in Geneva, Dr. Orantes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jory sits by the window and TEXTS messages to somebody somewhere. A blanket of bright white snow stretches invitingly.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: And she types back.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN...
dialogues.text: Through a window and into a TEENAGE BOY’S room. He lays o his bed thinking what boys think about. His phone reads:

dialogues.speaker: I WANT TO GO OUTSIDE AND JUMP IN THE SNOW
dialogues.text: He types back. She reads.

dialogues.speaker: I WANT TO JUMP ON YOU
dialogues.text: A little smile. Across the street another family is gathering up the fres snow in WATER JUGS and PAILS. Emhoff enters the living ro putting on his warmest clothes.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: They're doing a drop at the park. I’m gonna go help.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: I saw on the news that they’re getting closer to a vaccine.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Saw that, too. Then they just need to make about 6 billion doses. She hands him a piece of paper folded up.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unfolds it. A picture of the new iPhone.. He is confus

dialogues.speaker: JORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re not sure when delivery is gonna be back to normal. So for now you can just look at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFP
dialogues.text: Shoot, I should have done that. I’m sorry, Jory. Just stay inside. I’1lL let you beat me at Rock Band when I get back then I’ll take you to Mom’s. He walks outside. A STRAGGLE of NEIGHBORS keeps their distance all walking the same directions toward a pre- arranged locale. She watches him leave. Then returns to her texting. She sends:

dialogues.speaker: SNOW ANGELS
dialogues.text: She begins to put on her parka and snow boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cages line the walls. ‘Some more have died since the last time we have seen them. Most are empty now.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE CAGES
dialogues.text: Some LAB TECHS in full space suits take a sample from ano dead Rhesus-- number 23. They put the animal in a trash b Further down, another BENCH SCIENTIST examines MONKEY 57. Still alive. Resistant in some way. He pushes an intercom button on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: BENCH SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Fifty-seven. Symptom free for 72 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MILITARY PLANE flies over the snow covered park and dum out pallets with parachutes. They crash to the ground and their foil covered contents scatter around.

dialogues.speaker: A FEMA MAN
dialogues.text: Stands with a megaphone trying to bring order to the food dispersal.

dialogues.speaker: FEMA MAN
dialogues.text: Please observe social distancing policies when retrieving your MREs. One at a time. But, this isn’t going to work. Too many people. Some have shopping carts and others have wheel barrels. A SNOWMOBIL appears out of nowhere. . They race for the food like they’re dollar bills. A man h filled a SHOPPING CART and is trying to push it through t snow. A man with a BASEBALL BAT cuts him down at the knees-- ri in front of Emhoff.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Hey. Other PEOPLE descend on the shopping cart. A fight breaks out. BASEBALL BAT menaces an OLDER MAN.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: You don’t want me to breathe on you, bud. The OLDER MAN reaches into the cart.

dialogues.speaker: BASEBALL BAT
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Drop it. The Old Man looks up and spits at him. Baseball Bat recoi and rears up with the bat. Emhoff steps in. He stops the downstroke of the bat.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Let it go. The Old Man glares at Emhoff as well.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN _
dialogues.text: You stay away too, Hero. You don’t want what I've got. Emhoff wipes the spit off of Baseball Bat. He puts a coup of MREs in a shopping bag and troops off. INT. CDC - CHEEVER’S OFFICE/HEXTALL’S OFFICE - DAY Both on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: Nothing conclusive today.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Not much of a merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: I'm an atheist.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Science can do that to you.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: What‘re you gonna tell the administration today?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I’m going te tell them that we can’t protect people from madmen in airplanes, or greedy men in banks or very small organisms that move from one species to another. Then I'l) tell them we’re working on it. We're closer with every failure. Things like that. And then they‘1ll ask me “when?”

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: If we had it right now, we’d still need to do human trials. We'd have to figure out manufacturing and distribution, we’d have to figure out who gets it first-- the young, the military, people at risk... Roger the Janitor lingers down the hallway. Cheever gets and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTAGION 1/14/10 “105.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Homeland Security wants to know if we can put it in the water like fluoride. — ANGLE ON HEXTALL oe Hextall looks at a vial on her desk. VACCINE #57.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: In 1982 there was an Australian doctor who proved that stomach ulcers were caused by bacteria not stress. You know how?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nope. She takes out a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: Drank a bunch of water with the bugs in it and got sick. Won a Nobel Prize. Changed the way we treat ulcers. Barry Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Do we have anything even close?

dialogues.speaker: HEXTALL
dialogues.text: T’'1ll ask the monkeys and get back to you. She injects herself with vaccine. ' EXT. MINNEHAHA CREEK - MINNESOTA — SIMULTANEOUSLY Jory lies on her back in the snow making an angel. She we her protective mask-- the same cargo. plane flies over he

dialogues.speaker: A SHADOW PASSES OVER HER
dialogues.text: The TEENAGE BOY appears. He also wears a mask.

dialogues.speaker: JORY
dialogues.text: Don’t step on my angel. Her eyes smile. His smile back. He lies down on top of her. Their breath making soft clou The watch it dissipate in the cold air between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to lower his mask. She turns her head. Holds he breath.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE BOY
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Jory. If. neither of us have it, then we can’t give.it to each other. Instead, she unzips her jacket. He rolls over and does th same.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (O.S8.)
dialogues.text: (prelap) “Alas! Our ships enter. the port, but of a.thousand sailors hardly ten are spared, We reach our homes« our kindred and our neighbors come from all parts to visit us... She climbs. on top cf him-- cheek to cheek. Tentative.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: .+.Woe to us for we cast at them the darts of death! Whilst we spoke to them, whilst they embraced us and Kissed us, we scattered the poison from our lips... INT. KRUMWIEDE’S APARTMENT - EVENING He sits by himself in front of his web camera. Sweating. Reading aloud fron an old tattered book.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: .--They in turn soon infected their whole families, who in three days succumbed, and were puried in one common grave. Priests and doctors visiting the sick returned from their duties ill, and soon were numbered with the dead, Oh death! Cruel, bitter, impious. death! Which thus breaks the bonds of affection and divides father and mother, brother and sister, son and wife. Lamenting our misery, we feared toa fly, yet we dared not remain.” Gabriele de' Mussi, 1348, Genoa, Italy. The black plague. Here it comes again. : He puts a thermometer to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most of us will live. our immune systems will tell the story to our children’s immune systems. Most of US... The thermometer beeps. KRUMWIEDE (CONT’D) My temperature is 101-- higher than it was earlier. My head hurts and my throat feels like it‘s closing. He takes some forsythia tincture and drops it into water.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This.is Forsythia. I have been taking it since the onset of symptoms. He swallows the water. KRUMWIEDE (CONT’D) If you see me here tomorrow-- you will know if it works. INT. CHEEVER'S APARTMENT — NIGHT Cheever comes running in-- the place has been ransacked. door is shattered. Cupboards are emptied. Drawers are thr around. Aubrey is sobbing. Curled in a corner on the floo

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: They knew where you worked. They waited for you to leave. He gathers her up in his arms. AUBREY (CONT’D} They took the food and the water bottles. They went through the medicine chest. They asked where the cure was.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: The cure for what? He carries her into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: It’s because they saw you on the news and they heard about what happened, isn‘t it?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: It’s not you fault, Aub. It's all breaking down. There are studies that say it will fall apart now for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I tried to stop them. I did. ‘They threw me down. He puts her down on the bed-- steps back. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: They threw you down? I thought you said they didn’t touch you? Did they looks sick? A shadow of doubt crosses Cheever.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: They had masks on, Ellis. I cleaned everything after they left. You can smeil the ammonia. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to trust me, Ellis. He sits down next to her. Embarrassed by his own paranoia

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I trust you, Aub. I do.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Do you? But, does he? She moves to kiss him-- nuzzles him. Mingli breath. He is uncertain at first and then gives in to it. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRIVER who kidnapped Orantes takes her down a winding Staircase at a pace. She is hooded and stumbles to keep u

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Down, step, down, step...

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: I can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: We will trade you for a hundred doses.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: trade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no cure. You ca! me. There are no doses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the bottom of the stairs. Breathless.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yes, there is medicine. But, they won’t share it. It stays in Beijing. ‘Or Washington. Or London. They: watch us die from satellites while they give it to each other. He removes her hood. -

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are the cure. You're a mirror, He opens a door and pushes her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orantes’ eyes adjust to the light. She sees...

dialogues.speaker: A HUNDRED KIDS
dialogues.text: A few adults as well. Crowded into a room. Scared and hungry. Orantes shrinks from them. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Are they sick? The driver says something in CANTONESE to the group. She doesn't understand. Panic coming at her.

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t leave me in here. He moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: We need to save electricity. He kills the lights.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAPHONE, (9.S.)
dialogues.text: you will need identification that confirms your number is One. For today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cool spring day. People stand in line. Think of it like polling place. The people. keep their distance from each other. Signs on the wall remind them:

dialogues.speaker: SIX FEET IS SAFE
dialogues.text: Other signs tell people how to cough and not to shake han A new social order has taken hold in signage and custom. sign displays a crest with an EAGLE HOLDING A SYRINGE aga a US FLAG.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAPHONE
dialogues.text: If you have a fever-- you will not be given a vaccination. If you have received the vaccine, make certain that you are stamped on the left wrist.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK DOWN THE LINE
dialogues.text: Toward the front. NATIONAL GUARDSMAN keep it orderly. At the front of the line-now. A MIDDLE AGED man goes into curtained cubicle. One of ten. Inside he finds...

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Dressed in nurse’s attire. He administers the vaccine.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN
dialogues.text: You weren‘t one of the ones that went on strike were you?

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: No, just got trained in the last couple of months. A.program for the immune.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN
dialogues.text: You had it?

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had it. Head back. The man tilts his head back and Emhoff.sprays two bursts the man’s nose. pone

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN
dialogues.text: That’s it? Emhoff stamps his wrist with the EAGLE/SYRINGE crest like doorman at a bar-- the stamp works once and is discarded.

dialogues.speaker: EMHOFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN
dialogues.text: Seems so easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of buildings at the foot of the Tian Tan Buddha. DRIVER who abducted ORANTES comes down the steps of a monastery building. He carries a sidearm. He goes down the staircase to the LOCKED ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The same 100 children and Orantes. She feeds them. They teach her words of CANTONESE. She repeats after them and laughs-- then she teaches them the same words in English. Her other abductors also tend to the kids. Everyone is healthy. Isolated. The DRIVER comes over and kneels next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: They accepted the terms. She smiles-~ squeezés his hand. A look passes between the EXT. KRUMWIEDE‘S APARTMENT - DAY Krumwiede stands at the window with a microphone and an a A Shepard Fairey poster on the adjacent window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEW PEOPLE GATHER AROUND on the street below. Disciples Among them a MIDDLE AGED WOMAN who takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Today the government will begin poisoning the people. In 1976, we vaccinated against swine flu-and five hundred people got Guillain- Barré Syndrome. Twenty five people died. I had the virus-- I got through it. I took forsythia and I stayed away from others. What else is going up your nose when they tell you they are keeping you healthy? A police car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are my first amendment You are in violation of Viru rights. Freedom of assembly. Libel Code. Please cease and They’re throwing the desist or you will be charged constitution away. and arrested.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And taken where? What are you doing for prison guards? Who’s gonna try me? Where you gonna get a jury? The POLICE disperse the crowd. Krumwiede scatters the leaflets in the wind-- shuts the window. INT. CDC - CHEEVER‘S OFFICE - DAY Haggerty makes the rounds with TWO ARMED GUARDS. He has w him a cart filled with doses of MEV-1 VACCINE.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Two for Dr. Ellis Cheever and wife. Cheever takes the doses. HAGGERTY (CONT’D} Congrats on the marriage.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: We'll have a ceremony and party in a couple of months, once there's something resembling normal going on.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: You want me to give you yours now?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Nah, she’ll want us to do it together, I think she has champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggerty holds up his stamped ‘LEFT WRIST.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: See you at the airport?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Lawyer says I should stay out of sight for now. Bad idea to be part of the victory dance.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Screw ‘em. It‘s all politics, Ellis. Patriot Act won't apply here. Not to you taking care of your fiancée. Come on. The President’1l pardon you---if it i ever goes that far.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I‘ll watch you on TV. \ He leaves the box of vaccines with Cheever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUMWIEDE sits on a bench with the MIDDLE AGED WOMAN from outside his house. She is dressed conservatively. He sips water from a NALGENE bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: We've been following what you've been saying for some time now. You are in a unique position going forward-- something bigger than Forsythia.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I've been harassed and threatened. I've lost a family member. My mother. And they’ve accused me of fraud-- just because Forsythia made me some money.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Do you think you would be willing to help us? To reframe things. Use what has happened as a catalyst for change.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: After the Spanish Flu in 1918, you know, people got rich. Vicks VapoRub, Lysol. people. Look it up...A country slaughters all the chickens-- red meat goes into higher demand. Then a news story comes out and the price plummets. I’m a man stepping up to a microphone in front of a very large crowd. That’s who I am. You want to talk? Money talks. Krumwiede locks on a man in the distance. The man is with the PARKS DEPARTMENT. He has his finger in his ear-- mayb concealing a HEARING DEVICE. KRUMWIEDE (CONT’D) Is he with you? Are you wearing a wire?

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE. AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: What? Who? No. You're immune anyway aren’t you? > Krumwiede gets up and leaves-- walking briskly. Head on.a swivel, The PARKS DEPARTMENT MAN lays down his rake and begins to follow. Krumwiede looks back at. the MIDDLE AGED WOMAN. She reach into her bag and gets out a badge. Krumwiede begins to run across the park. Various PARKS DEPARTMENT MEN drop their rakes and converge. Alan isn’t much of an athlete. They quickly converge on him. KRUMWIEDE . For what? Tell me for what? The MIDDLE AGED WOMAN arrives.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: On your stomach, Alan. Do not attempt to cough or spit at any FBI personnel.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: This is entrapment.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: You never even had it. You lied. It’s a scam.

dialogues.speaker: . KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: Forsythia helped a lot of people-- the administration is in hed-with Big Pharma.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Forsythia helped you and a couple of other investors.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWIEDE
dialogues.text: I had it...I had it...

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: We’ll see, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: KRUMWLIEDE
dialogues.text: You can’t look at my blood. You can’t. THE AGENTS, in masks and gloves, twist tie his wrists and hood him. They take him away. EXT. KOWLOON LADIES’ MARKET - DAY Orantes stands with a GUN TO HER HEAD. It is held by THE DRIVER. Fifty yards away are CHINESE AUTHORITIES. Some ar armed. In the middle of them is LEOPOLD. He watches Orantes hopefully. TWO HOODED CHINESE NATIONALS pick up the boxes of vaccine bring it toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Is it French or American?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We could not get enough doses from the French. We are making it here now. Same formula.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Then we will not release her. The HOODED NATIONALS stand next to Orantes and the driver They rip into the boxes to explore the contents.  CONTAGION 1/14/10 116.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: We have shared the vaccine with the Chinese government-- it is being manufactured in Beijing. Please, let Dr. Orantes go. The driver rips open a packet. He tilts orantes’ head bac and sprays the vaccine up her nose.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: And now, what? We stand here for days and see if she gets sick?

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: (sotto) It’s the best we can hope for. The Driver weighs his options. On a signal the NATIONALS the boxes and head toward the van.. The Driver drags Oran back toward the van with him.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Nobody comes closer. They are back at the van now. Boxes loaded. One of the HOODED NATIONALS behind the wheel-- engine revving, The DRIVER pulls Orantes to the rear of the van. Hidden from sight. The Van peels out. Leaving...

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: Standing in the street. Hand-cuffs gone. Free. Leopold rushes toward her. He embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: LEOPOLD
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: ORANTES
dialogues.text: What could be safer than being a hostage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEEVER sits alone in the back seat of a Town Car. Music plays on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You want to hear the news instead?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Up to you.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anything you think I need to know? The Driver has more questions than a kid on Christmas, bu knows not to ask.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I’m sure you've heard it all before.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I saw a thing on the internet that said it isn’t random assignments. That people are forging and selling and that there’s politics in it. You think that’s true, Doctor Cheever?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I try not to go online anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I got number 59. They say that should be fine. You think that? You think that will be fine?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Sounds like a good number to me. Good odds.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I hear that. You know, I heard one of your co-workers say that it wouldn’t even happen in the spring or summer.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Maybe. It happens. It always happens. Nice out... Cheever puts down the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: He is wearing an N-95 particulate respirator mask. A litt soiled and tattered.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You sure that’s ccol, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER
dialogues.text: Turn left up here, Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Left. That’s not the way. Cheever puts a briefcase on the seat next to him. He unfo a slip of paper and hands it forward. The DRIVER takes it from him. He wears RUBBER GLOVES.

dialogues.speaker: CHEEVER,
dialogues.text: Just turn up here. We have to make a stop.
